Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory
  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an inventory management system for electronic devices.

    This class manages a collection of electronic devices, allowing for the addition, removal, and updating of devices. Devices are grouped by category for efficient management.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.LinkedList<java.util.ArrayList<Device>> deviceGroups
      Stores groups of devices, with each group containing devices of the same category.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Inventory()
      Constructs an empty inventory.

    • Field Detail

      • deviceGroups

        private java.util.LinkedList<java.util.ArrayList<Device>> deviceGroups
        Stores groups of devices, with each group containing devices of the same category.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Constructs an empty inventory.

        Time complexity: O(1) - The initialization of an empty LinkedList is a constant time operation, as it simply allocates memory for the list without adding any elements.

    • Method Detail

      • addDevice

        public void addDevice​(Device device)
        Adds a device to the inventory. If the device's category does not already exist, a new category group is created and added to the inventory.

        This method iterates through the list of device groups to find a matching category. If no matching category is found, a new list for the device's category is created and added. The time complexity of this operation primarily depends on the number of device categories currently in the inventory.

        Time complexity: O(n) where n is the number of device categories. In the worst case, this method may iterate through all existing categories before adding a new device or creating a new category group.

        Parameters:
        device - The device to be added to the inventory.

      • removeDevice

        public boolean removeDevice​(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a device from the inventory by its name. If multiple devices have the same name, the first one found is removed.

        Time complexity: O(n*m) where n is the number of device categories and m is the average number of devices per category. In the worst case, this method iterates through all devices in all categories.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the device was found and removed, false otherwise.

      • updateDeviceDetails

        public boolean updateDeviceDetails​(java.lang.String name,
                                   double price,
                                   int quantity)
        Updates the details of a device identified by its name. If a device with the specified name is found, its price and quantity are updated.

        Time complexity: O(n*m) where n is the number of device categories and m is the average number of devices per category. This is because, in the worst case, the method may need to iterate through all devices in all categories to find the matching device.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device to update.
        price - The new price of the device, must be positive to be updated.
        quantity - The new quantity of the device, must be non-negative to be updated.
        Returns:
        true if the device was found and updated, false otherwise.

      • displayAllDevices

        public void displayAllDevices()
        Displays all devices in the inventory to the standard output, grouped by category.

        This method iterates through each category of devices, displaying each device's details. The output includes the category, name, price, and quantity of each device.

        Time complexity: O(n) where n is the total number of devices in all categories. The method performs a single iteration over all devices, making it linear in terms of the number of devices.

      • findCheapestDevice

        public Device findCheapestDevice()
        Finds and returns the device with the lowest price in the inventory. If there are multiple devices with the same lowest price, the first one found is returned.

        This method iterates through all device categories and devices within those categories to identify the one with the lowest price.

        Time complexity: O(n) where n is the total number of devices in the inventory. This is because the method performs a single pass over all devices to find the one with the lowest price.

        Returns:
        The cheapest device in the inventory, or null if the inventory is empty.

      • getSortedDevicesByPrice

        public java.util.ArrayList<Device> getSortedDevicesByPrice()
        Returns a list of all devices in the inventory, sorted by price in ascending order.

        This method collects all devices from each category into a single list, then sorts that list by the price of the devices in ascending order. The sorting uses a comparator based on the device price.

        Time complexity: O(n log n), where n is the total number of devices in the inventory. The collection of devices into a single list is O(n), and the sort operation dominates the time complexity, which is O(n log n) for comparison-based sorting algorithms.

        Returns:
        A sorted list of all devices, from the lowest to the highest price.

      • calculateTotalInventoryValue

        public double calculateTotalInventoryValue()
        Calculates and returns the total value of the inventory based on the price and quantity of each device.

        This method iterates through each device category and each device within those categories, summing up the products of the price and quantity of each device to compute the total inventory value.

        Time complexity: O(n), where n is the total number of devices in the inventory. The method performs a single pass over all devices, with the operation within the loop (multiplication and addition) being constant time operations.

        Returns:
        The total value of the inventory, calculated as the sum of the products of price and quantity for each device.

      • restockDevice

        public boolean restockDevice​(java.lang.String name,
                             int quantity,
                             boolean addStock)
        Adjusts the stock of a specified device by its name. Stock can be added or removed based on the addStock flag.

        This method searches through the inventory to find the device with the specified name. Once found, the stock level is adjusted by either adding or subtracting the specified quantity. Stock levels are not allowed to go below zero.

        Time complexity: O(n*m) where n is the number of device categories and m is the average number of devices per category. In the worst case, the method may need to iterate through all devices in all categories to find the matching device by name.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device to restock.
        quantity - The quantity to add or remove from the device's stock.
        addStock - If true, stock is added; if false, stock is removed, ensuring the stock doesn't fall below zero.
        Returns:
        true if the device was found and its stock adjusted, false otherwise.

      • getAllDevices

        public java.util.ArrayList<Device> getAllDevices()
        Retrieves a list of all devices in the inventory, regardless of category.

        This method compiles a comprehensive list of all devices stored in the inventory, effectively flattening the structure of categories into a single list.

        Time complexity: O(n) where n is the total number of devices in the inventory. The complexity arises from iterating through each category and adding all devices to the new list, which is a linear operation with respect to the total number of devices.

        Returns:
        A list of all devices, not categorized.
